author: Ong Weisheng
text:
Sold a Junya Watanabe jacket to a buyer in the USA.

Package took longer then usual to deliver due to the pandemic but buyer requested a full refund from Paypal despite me providing the tracking number and website and mentioning that there will be a delay due to the pandemic.

Despite multiple tries, there was no reply at all from the US Postal Services when my local postal service contacted them.

Whether the parcel reached the buyer or not, I am not sure but it seems there are zero protection policies in place for the sellers on Grailed, meaning the buyer could've gotten the item but claim otherwise.

Grailed did not even bother to reply me when I enquired about this issue and it's been around two months since I submitted the enquiry.

I think Grailed should implement fairer policies that can ensure the safety of both buyers and sellers from scammers.

--

To Grailed team, please contact me via my account name Wei. If it's possible. I'm not about to give my email address out in the open. Thanks
title: Zero protection policy for Sellers

author: Martins
text:
I have been selling on grailed since a year ago. There was no problem. I considered Grailed to be a safe marketplace. When this pandemic started, I had 2 cases that were closed with a refund to the buyers, due to delivery delays (total amount 170USD). After a while, I tracked the packages and saw they were delivered. I have contacted grailed to help me, and had no response.
Two days ago, grailed froze my account. I have 70 positive feedbacks and 1 negative, from a buyer who claimed I was a scam, due to delayed delivery, who received the package in the meantime. I also got in touch with grailed due to this VERY BAD REVIEW, which was not my fault, (I provided tracking, and now the package has been delivered) and grailed never responds me.
Now, I have my account frozen, because they told me I sell counterfeits. I did sent an email asking details, which itens were fakes, and got no response. I would like to say that I don't sell counterfeits, I never did, I never will. I also would like to say, that even if I were doing something against grailed policies, it is not a proper way to treat people. I can't enter my account, I cannot respond to the people who bought from me. Also several cases were opened against me on PayPal, just because they saw I was banned. I did ship all my packages with tracking, which is a relief, because when they are delivered, I will receive my money back. But once again, grailed don't treat people well. I should be allowed at least to enter my account and talk to the people who bought recently. Not be able to sell, but to give people a word.
I really hope I can get an answer from grailed and have a chance to defend myself. Or at least, a proof that I am selling the counterfeit pieces, like they told me.
It is very unfair all this situation and I am truly disappointed with Grailed. After reading all this reviews on Trustpilot, I see I am not alone....
title: DiSAPPOINTMENT

author: Juan H
text:
So i’m here today to discuss what seems to be an ongoing and never ending problem that many sellers have to go through, particularly the reputable ones unfortunately. I’m a seller on Grailed, have been since September 2019 and i’ve had 36 transactions on the platform, 31 reviews all 5 stars so I like to think i’m an honest seller. Fortunately this is my first issue i’ve had (unlike many other sellers I see have had this chargeback scam pulled on them numerous times), what annoys me is the nature of this case. I sold a user an ERD t shirt back in September, he was a problem from the start, he had tried to make me engage in offsite activity - which I did not, and to make the situation worse his account has a red strikethrough, so he’s obviously been banned for something, chargeback fraud maybe? Username is Kerwinfrust. So 11 MONTHS LATER, a whole 11 MONTHS we’re talking almost a whole calendar year, he opens a chargeback case against me and my account on Paypal is now in negative balance. Paypal have updated me saying that they’re going to have to discuss with the financial issuer now to see if they can recoup my money, but as we all know it will most likely result in me losing out and the buyer keeping a free t shirt. Transactions total was $270, and you know it shouldn’t be much of a debate, this case realistically should be closed decided easily, if you’re opening a case of “item not as described” you do that upon receiving the goods, not 11 months later. I have screenshots of his account being banned, the conversations, I still even kept the shipping receipt from last year September 2019 because I know you can never be too sure when there’s people like this about. 

I’ve been trying to contact Grailed to make them aware of the situation and they seem to not be replying now, whereas when I asked them to add a new brand so I could sell something on their platform they’d reply in a matter of hours, funny. It’s amusing that they charge you 9% fees, which in fairness to them is cheaper than eBay, but they charge you a fee for using their platform and you’d assume protection comes with that, otherwise if they’re not going to cover you then everyone may as well go elsewhere or sell offsite no? To rub salt in the wounds further, their automated email reply states “Please remember all transactions are covered by PayPal and Grailed Protection. We'll get your item or money back guaranteed!” I’d like to see this in action now, practice what you preach. Furthermore when you see the reviews on here and there are more negative than positive reviews, well I guess that speaks for itself...
title: Grailed Chargeback scam 11 MONTHS LATER
